title: How to Add a Windows Movie Maker Video to YouTube

steps.headline: Open your movie file in Windows Movie Maker.
Click the "Publish Movie" button or "Save Movie" button (in Windows XP).
Click "Save To This Computer" and save it to the location that you want.
Go to "More Settings" on the next screen and pick the last option (for a .wmv file at 1 megabyte per second).
Finish the operation by hitting "Publish" and then "Finish" when the operation is complete.
Close Windows Movie maker and go to Youtube.com.
Click on the "Upload" button in the top right of your YouTube home page.
Click on "Upload Video" and browse to where you saved your movie.
Confirm your selection and fill out the various fields: description, title and any others.
Upload your video and watch it to make sure it works.

text: Open your movie file in Windows Movie Maker.  Click the "Publish Movie" button or "Save Movie" button (in Windows XP).  Click "Save To This Computer" and save it to the location that you want.  Go to "More Settings" on the next screen and pick the last option (for a .wmv file at 1 megabyte per second).  Finish the operation by hitting "Publish" and then "Finish" when the operation is complete.  Close Windows Movie maker and go to Youtube.com. Sign in to your account. Click on the "Upload" button in the top right of your YouTube home page.  Click on "Upload Video" and browse to where you saved your movie. Select it. Confirm your selection and fill out the various fields: description, title and any others.  Upload your video and watch it to make sure it works.
sentences: Open your movie file in Windows Movie Maker.
Click the "Publish Movie" button or "Save Movie" button (in Windows XP).
Click "Save To This Computer" and save it to the location that you want.
Go to "More Settings" on the next screen and pick the last option (for a .wmv file at 1 megabyte per second).
Finish the operation by hitting "Publish" and then "Finish" when the operation is complete.
Close Windows Movie maker and go to Youtube.com.
Click on the "Upload" button in the top right of your YouTube home page.
Click on "Upload Video" and browse to where you saved your movie.
Confirm your selection and fill out the various fields: description, title and any others.
Upload your video and watch it to make sure it works.
